description: Interim manager Calum McFarlane credits the leaders in the Chelsea dressing room for the character they have shown through a tumultuous week which saw manager Enzo Maresca sacked.

title: Expected Chelsea boss Rosenior has 'served his apprenticeship'
description: Match of the Day pundits discuss the expected appointment of Liam Rosenior as Chelsea head coach following the departure of Enzo Maresca amid internal tensions at the club.

title: 'It's not enough'- Slot frustrated with Fulham draw
description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "it's not enough" for his side to rely on late goals after a "frustrating" 2-2 draw against Fulham at Craven Cottage.

title: 'Haunted Nancy detached from reality as Celtic's lights go out'
description: BBC Sport Scotland's chief sports writer dissects the outcome of Saturday's Old Firm defeat for Celtic.

title: 'I needed them and they were there' - when young players find new homes
description: BBC Sport explores how young footballers build bonds with second families when they leave home to sign for a new club on their path to the top.

title: The story of a successful British WWII deception operation
description: A mocked idea to feed false plans to the Nazis via a drowned corpse is brought to life.

title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin
description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

title: 'Good idea' or taking 'massive chance' - is Rosenior ready for Chelsea?
description: Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to become the Chelsea manager. BBC Sport looks at the reasons why.

title: 'We need to protect players' - how can tennis avoid breaking point?
description: With the 2026 tennis season kicking off, BBC Sport analyses why many top players are complaining about burnout and what could be done to prevent it.

title: Bradley didn't take chance to curb 'horrific' Ryder Cup abuse - McIlroy
description: Rory McIlroy says that US captain Keegan Bradley "didn't" help to rein in unacceptable and abusive behaviour at last year's Ryder Cup.

title: What went wrong between Chelsea and Maresca?
description: Less than six months after guiding Chelsea to Club World Cup success, Enzo Maresca has left. But how did things unravel?

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men‚Äôs tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry ‚Äì and where it could go next.
